content:
• Friday, July 13, 2012
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -16.3%) closes at multi-year lows thanks to an ugly Q2 warning. Goldman (Sell) is...

    Lexmark (LXK -16.3%) closes at multi-year lows thanks to an ugly Q2 warning. Goldman (Sell) is taking a hammer to its 2013 and 2014 estimates, declaring the headwinds to Lexmark's high-margin printing supplies business to be worse than feared. Though no full-year guidance revision was provided, Brean Murray thinks 2012 EPS could be around $4, compared with prior guidance of $4.70-$4.90 - that still gives Lexmark a forward P/E of just 5. HPQ -1.9%. XRX -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +4.3%) and Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +5%) end the day with strong gains...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +4.3%) and Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +5%) end the day with strong gains thanks to bullish coverage launches. The former received Buy rating and $18 PT from Capstone, while the latter was given a Buy and $28 PT from ThinkEquity.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • SQBG

    Shares of Martha Stewart Omnimedia (MSO -2.5%) fall after Macy's wins a court order in a case...

    Shares of Martha Stewart Omnimedia (MSO -2.5%) fall after Macy's wins a court order in a case against the firm. Macy's alleges it was harmed due to a secretive licensing deal signed between Martha Stewart and J.C. Penney that violated its own agreement with the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan (JPM +5.4%) CIO Risk Manager Irvin Goldman has resigned in response to major trading...

    JPMorgan (JPM +5.4%) CIO Risk Manager Irvin Goldman has resigned in response to major trading losses and a criminal investigation. Bank stocks continue to shoot higher (XLF +2.4%), as the Street gives a thumbs-up to JPMorgan and Wells Fargo's (WFC +3.1%) Q2 reports (I, II). (more on JPM)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 9 Comments
  • OUTR

    Shares of Coinstar (CSTR -3.3%) slump on heavy volume after Dougherty's Steve Frankel issues...

    Shares of Coinstar (CSTR -3.3%) slump on heavy volume after Dougherty's Steve Frankel issues cautious comments on the firm's revenue potential in Q3 with Hollywood blockbusters front-loaded seasonally. Looking further out, the analysts frets over the costs associated with Coinstar's ambitious venture with Verizon to create a streaming service.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 4 Comments
  • JPM

    The criminal investigation into JPMorgan (JPM +5.1%) focuses on employees who worked in the...

    The criminal investigation into JPMorgan (JPM +5.1%) focuses on employees who worked in the London office, according to sources. Though not a surprise, the development adds more weight to the notion that the London Whale saga will end in indictments - not fines.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • SODA

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +1.4%) hold on to their gains, even with the floor falling out from...

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +1.4%) hold on to their gains, even with the floor falling out from under Green Mountain Coffee Roasters. It's a nice decoupling for SODA after the stock seemed to get lumped in with recent GMCR selloffs. As for matters close to hand, the company has its products in 2.9K Wal-Mart stores with early (anecdotal) channel checks coming in positive for sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • IP

    Shares of paper industry players International Paper (IP +2.5%), Rock-Tenn (RKT +2.6%), and...

    Shares of paper industry players International Paper (IP +2.5%), Rock-Tenn (RKT +2.6%), and Packaging of America (PKG +0.5%) fire up gains, helped in part by news that containerboard prices are on the rise.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK +1.8%) spike higher from negative territory after CEO Angel...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK +1.8%) spike higher from negative territory after CEO Angel Martinez discloses in a SEC filing purchasing 10K shares. The relatively minor buy went off at $45.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD -10.2%) crashes after disclosing it's discontinuing development for...

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD -10.2%) crashes after disclosing it's discontinuing development for its AM-831 schizophrenia drug after it failed to "meet pre-determined criteria for further development in Phase I testing." AM-831 was being developed in partnership with Japan's Meiji Seika Pharma.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -5.7%) can't catch a break. Shares are diving yet again after a presentation...

    Questcor (QCOR -5.7%) can't catch a break. Shares are diving yet again after a presentation (.pdf) from Chief Scientific Officer David Young at a JMP conference failed to soothe fears stoked by a brutal Citron Research report on Tuesday. While discussing how Questcor's Acthar gel is differentiated, Young's review of the history of generic/third-party alternatives (page 11) may have done more harm than good. Questcor is down 25% from Monday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +17%) adds to the huge gains seen yesterday following a deal that will result...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +17%) adds to the huge gains seen yesterday following a deal that will result in its Omontys anemia drug being supplied to 100 U.S. dialysis centers run by Germany's Fresenius. Piper thinks the deal could deliver $700M in sales of Omontys, which requires fewer injections than rival products, and that a longer-term deal with Fresenius could be reached.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart (WMT +0.9%) prints another all-time high at $72.99 with more data out suggesting the...

    Wal-Mart (WMT +0.9%) prints another all-time high at $72.99 with more data out suggesting the company is taking market share away from grocery stores. The company's ability to offer better pricing on popular foods items has transitioned a growing number of consumers into systematic WMT shoppers - instead of occasional fly-by visitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMBO

    Ambo Education Holding (AMBO +14.1%) soars after announcing a stock buyback. The company sells...

    Ambo Education Holding (AMBO +14.1%) soars after announcing a stock buyback. The company sells educational services in China which is a whole different ball of wax than in the U.S. where government pressures have increased on for-profit education names. (Previous: Dark clouds on education sector)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • WFC

    Along with reiterating confidence in Wells Fargo (WFC +3.2%), Warren Buffett says Berkshire...

    Along with reiterating confidence in Wells Fargo (WFC +3.2%), Warren Buffett says Berkshire Hathaway has cut its stake in ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP) and bought into Phillips 66 (PSX +4.5%) after the oil giant spun off the refining operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • BT

    The EU is backtracking on plans to force incumbent telcos to charge lower fees to rivals to use...

    The EU is backtracking on plans to force incumbent telcos to charge lower fees to rivals to use their networks to deliver broadband services. The decision, which is part of a broader effort to set rules aimed at stoking the continent's broadband investments, appears to be giving a lift to the shares of debt-laden incumbents. BT +3.9%. TI +4.5%. FTE +5%. OTCQX:DTEGY +5.7% on the Frankfurt exchange.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • JRCCQ

    Shares of James River Coal (JRCC -4.1%) slump after an operational update from CONSOL Energy...

    Shares of James River Coal (JRCC -4.1%) slump after an operational update from CONSOL Energy (CNX +2.0%) points to lower production in Q3. Consol may be trading higher in reaction to word that two of its key mines were accident-free during the last quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC +3.8%) rallies on a report from Veritas Investment that speculates Canadian...

    Kinross Gold (KGC +3.8%) rallies on a report from Veritas Investment that speculates Canadian peer Barrick Gold (ABX) will make an offer. Veritas argues Barrick is motivated to increase its scale at a time when major new gold discoveries are difficult to find, and that the recent drop in Kinross' shares will make the miner amenable to a deal. Stifel thinks Kinross' valuation and growth profile will appeal to Barrick, though Barrick's high debt load makes an all-cash offer unlikely.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 2 Comments
  • WHITF

    Whitehaven Coal (OTCPK:WHITF) sees a $5.4B bid from an Australian billionaire come in that marks...

    Whitehaven Coal (OTCPK:WHITF) sees a $5.4B bid from an Australian billionaire come in that marks a lush 51% premium to Friday's closing price in Melbourne. The deal could raise the profile of the group a tad. Coal stocks (KOL +1.5%) are up for the day after recording a dismal week with Patriot Coal filing bankruptcy and more demand issues cropping up.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -7.1%) give up their defense of the $20 level to...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -7.1%) give up their defense of the $20 level to skip to only a few pennies away from a 52-week low. A damaging note from Stifel is the domino that triggered a new bout of selling.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 8 Comments
  • ANRZQ

    Energy stocks show steady gains with Alpha Natural (ANR +1.9%), Noble (NE +2.4%), and Cabot Oil...

    Energy stocks show steady gains with Alpha Natural (ANR +1.9%), Noble (NE +2.4%), and Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +2.6%) providing some of the fuel for today's gain in the S&P 500 Index. Oil prices are up for the day on a "mini-relief" rally tied in part to China's Q2 GDP report that didn't come in any worse than expected. Brent crude +1.0% to 102.110, WTI crude +0.9% to 86.86.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • FN

    Fifth & Pacific's (FN +1.5%) Kate Spade unit exercised an option to acquire the interest of...

    Fifth & Pacific's (FN +1.5%) Kate Spade unit exercised an option to acquire the interest of its joint venture partner in Kate Spade Japan. The company says the price for the buyout will be $45M-$50M, including debt repayment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU +3.4%) and merger partner Tudou (TUDO +4.1%) are rallying after Youku receives...

    Youku.com (YOKU +3.4%) and merger partner Tudou (TUDO +4.1%) are rallying after Youku receives positive comments from JPMorgan and OTR Global. JPM, which launched coverage on Monday, says the recent weakness in Youku shares, caused by the resignation of Tudou's COO, is overblown. OTR argues online video ad spending remains healthy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • BPI

    Shares of Bridgepoint Education (BPI -22.2%) fall apart after the company receives notification...

    Shares of Bridgepoint Education (BPI -22.2%) fall apart after the company receives notification that Ashford is under watch by an education commission to confirm whether or not the university meets criteria for accreditation. This week couldn't end quick enough for execs with the firm as shares have fallen off more than 54%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • HOV

    Hovnanian (HOV +10.5%) jumps after announcing a land banking arrangement worth up to $125M with...

    Hovnanian (HOV +10.5%) jumps after announcing a land banking arrangement worth up to $125M with Blackstone's (NYSE:BX) GSO Capital arm. GSO will buy land parcels from Hovnanian, and option finished lots back to the company. In addition, GSO has agreed to exchange $15M worth of Hovnanian senior notes for 3.86M Class A shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • PSX

    Phillips (PSX +5.1%) jumps higher after Warren Buffett says he bought a stake in the company.

    Phillips (PSX +5.1%) jumps higher after Warren Buffett says he bought a stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 5 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) -1.2% and Xerox (NYSE:XRX) -2.7% following Lexmark's (NYSE:LXK) Q2 warning. In...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) -1.2% and Xerox (NYSE:XRX) -2.7% following Lexmark's (NYSE:LXK) Q2 warning. In spite of a recent sales drop, H-P's printing business still accounts for over a quarter of its profits, and the warning is likely stoking fears the industry is in a long-term decline. Ahead of Lexmark's announcement, Barclays issued a bearish note about the impact of managed print services and mobile imaging on printing demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • HOV

    Premarket gainers: HOV +8%. PBR +5%. Losers: TEU -17%. LXK -16%. AMPE -11%. ACAD -6%.

    Premarket gainers: HOV +8%. PBR +5%.
    Losers: TEU -17%. LXK -16%. AMPE -11%. ACAD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • TEU

    Shares of Box Ships (NYSE:TEU) fall 16.8% premarket after the company announces a public...

    Shares of Box Ships (NYSE:TEU) fall 16.8% premarket after the company announces a public offering for $30M worth of its common stock. The proceeds from the sale will be used to retire high-interest debt, according to the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) fall 3.8% premarket with comments from...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) fall 3.8% premarket with comments from Stifel Nicolaus tipping sentiment. Utilizing scanner data as a basis, analysts warn the company could be negatively impacted by K-Cup pricing trends and promotional trends. Estimates for FY13 EPS are slashed by Stifel to $1.80 from $2.27 and a Sell rating is upheld.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • IGTE

    iGATE (NASDAQ:IGTE): Q2 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $268M (+57.3% Y/Y) in-line....

    iGATE (NASDAQ:IGTE): Q2 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $268M (+57.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM
  • PEUGY

    Shares of Peugeot (OTCPK:PEUGY) tumble 8.8% in London trading after Moody's placed the...

    Shares of Peugeot (OTCPK:PEUGY) tumble 8.8% in London trading after Moody's placed the automaker's credit rating on review for a downgrade. The ratings agency cited further deterioration in capacity at Peugeot's plants in Europe in taking its action.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 AM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM): Q2 EPS of $1.21 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.75. Revenue of...

    JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM): Q2 EPS of $1.21 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.75. Revenue of $22.89B (-16% Y/Y) beats by $1B. Shares +2.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 AM | 5 Comments

  • Not joining in the EU stock rally is Italy, which is -0.6% following Moody's two-notch downgrade...

    Not joining in the EU stock rally is Italy, which is -0.6% following Moody's two-notch downgrade yesterday, while yields on 10-year Italian bonds are +13 bps at 6.04%. The ratings cut doesn't bode well for an Italian bond auction today, when the government hopes to sell €5.25B of paper with maturities of up to 11 years. Madrid shares are also down, -0.8%, while 10-year yields are +9 bps at 6.72%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 AM

  • European shares are mostly higher, led by oil and mining stocks, on relief that China's GDP came...

    European shares are mostly higher, led by oil and mining stocks, on relief that China's GDP came in as expected and didn't contain a nasty surprise, but was bad enough that more stimulus could be on the cards. EU Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London +0.5%, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt +0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 AM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) revised its financial outlook late yesterday, issuing downside FQ2 EPS...

    Lexmark (NYSE:LXK) revised its financial outlook late yesterday, issuing downside FQ2 EPS guidance of $0.87-0.89 vs. consensus of $1.00. Sees FQ2 revenue -12% Y/Y, or ~$919.6M vs. $960.8M consensus. Demand was weaker than expected, especially in Europe, and currency fluctuations were larger than expected. Both factors are expected to impact H2. Shares -9.5% AH, after falling 7.5% in regular trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 AM
